title: Associate - Commercial Sales (B2B & B2G)
content:
About Pula
At Pula, we are radically restructuring agricultural insurance, using technology to insure the previously unbanked, uninsured, untapped market of 1.5 billion smallholders worldwide. 
We work in over 17 countries across Africa and Asia, and by 2021, we have facilitated crop insurance cover to over 5.3 million farmers across Kenya, India, Rwanda, Uganda, Nigeria, Mali, Senegal, Zambia, Ethiopia, Madagascar, Tanzania, and Malawi. Since raising our Series A our operations have expanded globally including now Asia and Latin America.
Pula is a fast-paced space, constantly adapting to new opportunities and challenges and we are made up of a high-performance, multi-cultural team. We expect our team to value performance, results and professionalism.
At Pula, our values are: 

Obsessed with results: We are responsible for our future and therefore we get things done!
Connect the Dots: We continuously identify different customer needs & business problems and build solutions that deliver value.
Have a Can do Attitude! We dare to do things differently to make things work.
We have each others’ back: We look out for each other & we share high quality, timely feedback that makes us better.
What you will be doing:
The Pula Commercial Manager is far from the typical sales role. You must be passionate to find meaning in your work. Willing to go the extra mile to evangelize the importance of crop insurance in transforming the lives of millions of small farmers across multiple stakeholders, from political elites to government systems, development agencies to the farmer. For you to be successful in the role, you need to consider it as your mission - “how you will be remembered”. While you are at it, you will be richly rewarded as we believe in “doing good and doing good”. While impacting hundreds of millions of farmers, our mantra is that those who are successful in the mission should be dollar millionaires in the end. In Pula, good deeds are rewarded.
Every day your role will involve;
Client management

Participate in all recurring meetings internally and with the customer support team to enhance cordial relationships and customer satisfaction. Therefore, a high and smooth renewal rate.
Specifically ensuring that Crop Development Reports, mid-season and end-of-season reports are generated in a timely manner and in the formats required by the client and presented to them. This increases customer satisfaction and ensures a smooth payment process.
Maintain an adequate customer data sheet that includes critical customer details - such as when the quote is prepared and approved, to increase timeliness in presenting to them, especially in Collecting all customer complaints during the season and ensuring that they are all captured while the payment report is made.
Train regional and district staff of the client and stakeholders.
Manage client accounts while CM/CD is on leave.
Manage and improve sales tools and processes, for example CRM.
Assist with administrative tasks, such as requests, preparation of workshops.

Administrative support

Assist the line manager in writing meeting notes in the appropriate tool, recording the meeting and filing the notes/recordings in the client folder.
Internal coordination with relevant teams to ensure that customers and commercial managers have accurate and reliable information.
Coordinate with the team carrying out producer registration (whether client or PULA) to ensure we receive producer lists on time and correctly.
Cooperate with internal department to update tools like click-up.

Market research and pipeline development

Provide research support on new markets and new customers, carrying out research and analysis to identify business and customer opportunities.

Sales

Pursue leads, reach out via calls and mail, and schedule appointments

What you need to have to be successful:

You live it. You are the best at this. You love it!
You have a strong interest in a career in sales.
You are open working in a sales target environment.
You have a passion for working in the public sector and NGO environment.
Critical thinking skills. You must have the ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions.
You have at least 3 years of experience working in an environment that requires people skills, relationship development and management.
Behavioral Skills. You must be self-directed, work well alone or in a team structure, highly results-oriented, and willing to learn and expand your product and technical knowledge base. through formal education, professional training and self-study.
Transferable skills from a customer relations role.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills, integrity and impeccable professionalism.
Experience and knowledge in the insurance industry will give you an advantage.
You have the ability to use data and KPIs to make management decisions.
You are fully comfortable with Google Drive apps like Google Sheets, Google Docs as well as MS Office apps like PowerPoint, excel, etc.
What Pula will bring to the table

Growth potential: With an untapped market of 1.5 billion smallholders worldwide, on track to doubling the number of farmers insured in 2021 and Pula’s global leadership in Agriculture Insurance, the Commercial Director has a tremendous upside growth potential.
Market Leader: Not only is the opportunity massive, but Pula is by far the market leader in it’s category with 5.3m farmers insured as at the end of 2021.
Solid: Pula has been funded by leading venture capital investors (Omidyar Network, ACCION, MercyCorps) and global philanthropic institutions (MasterCard Foundation, CGAP/World Bank as well as the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation). Pula closed a  $6m series A funding in December 2020 in the right in middle of the pandemic a clear testimony of the opportunity that Pula is going after.
Respected: Winner of the Singapore FinTech Festival 2019, Winner of The InsureTech of the Award, Africa. Featured on TED talks, The New York Times, The Economist.
Impact and creation: This is a high-impact role, reporting to the CEO and Co-Founder, that offers a unique opportunity to bring the company to the next level, whilst developing new strategies, approaches and ideas.
Leadership: The founders & CEO foster a culture of transparency, respect, high performance, pragmatism, execution and personal development.
Purpose: It is rare to find a professional opportunity that offers accelerated professional development and a life purpose. Pula is going through a second phase of accelerated growth that will naturally provide professional development, whilst contributing to the financial stability of small farmers in the emerging markets.
Remuneration: Competitive base salary accordingly with seniority and experience, commission on closed sales and an employee share option plan that offers an attractive equity upside.

To learn more about Pula you can visit

TED Talk: Crop Insurance, an Idea Worth Seeding
New York Times: He Grew up on a Farm. Now, He Helps Protect Them
The Economist: The Poor, Who Most Need Insurance, Are Least Likely to Have It

How to apply
Fill out the form below, and upload a resume in English.
Cover letters are optional. You can add one if there is any additional information you would like to share about your interest in Pula, the role or your experience. We review applications on a rolling basis.
Pula’s mission is to provide farmer resilience. To achieve this, we put our small holder farmers that use our services and the employees that provide them at the heart of everything we do. For that purpose, Pula was created to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

compliance.description: <p>PUBLIC BURDEN STATEMENT: According to the Paperwork Reduction Act of 1995 no persons are required to respond to a collection of information unless such collection displays a valid OMB control number. This survey should take about 5 minutes to complete.</p>

questions.label: DisabilityStatus

values.label: I do not want to answer
No, I do not have a disability and have not had one in the past
Yes, I have a disability, or have had one in the past

values.label: I identify as one or more of the classifications of a protected veteran
I am not a protected veteran

values.label: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

questions.label: Gender
First Name
Last Name
Email
Phone
Resume/CV
Cover Letter
Preferred Name
Do you currently work at Pula?
How did you learn about this job

values.label: A pula employee reached out to me on Linkedin

questions.label: If you answered "Referred by a Pula Employee" above, what is their name?
How many overall years of relevant experience do you have?
In what country are you Located

values.label: Tanzania; officially the United Republic of Tanzania

questions.label: For the instances that you missed your sales targets in your career, what was the reason?

values.label: Lack of support from my supervisor
The product was not responding to the market needs
I have always met my targets in my career
My mistakes or lack of skills/experience

questions.label: In selling to Government/Public Sector, which of the following best describes your approach?

values.label: I get to the main decision maker to my side
I understand the power dynamics, build relationships with multiple stakeholders
I leverage my existing networks. Usually that is enough since I’m well networked.
Sign an agreement with a partner who has dealt with the Government before.

questions.label: In the past 5 years, careerwise what have you spent most of your time doing?

values.label: A) Thinking strategically on how to deliver on customer promises
B) Building a team of sales teams to deliver the numbers
C) Developing direct relationships with clients and or government agencies.
D) Signing partnerships with distributors for my products to ensure scale
E) Putting together and executing market entry strategies

questions.label: What is the most important factor in closing a deal with a government entity?

values.label: Value proposition that you put forth
A trusting relationship with the most senior person in a deal
A strong brand in the market that you are selling
Partnership with a trusted dealership in the country

questions.label: What is your most critical strength in sales (i.e. your superpower)?
What of the following do you consider as the most important factor towards hitting your annual sales targets?

values.label: Understanding the product you are selling
Having a few deals that you can rely on

questions.label: Which of the following best describes your personality?

values.label: It is important that the company I work for is well-known in the market/industry.
Making an Impact is very important to me.
I always find new ways to make money for my company or myself.
I prefer understanding the product and company before starting to sell it

questions.label: Which of the following is true on how to motivate for a budget with a Government?

values.label: It is a tedious process involving committee, pilots, Concept Notes, Parliamentary  approval and can take 2 - 3 years. Also requires a good understanding of the budget making process.
It depends on the person you engage and with the right contacts it can be fast. It is better to find an existing budget line that can be utilized.
The Ministry of Finance is as important as the implementing Ministry but using the President's office might be more efficient.
It is easier for a new government that has come into power but depends on the level of centralization/decentralization in a government.

questions.label: What would you do if you were given $100 and told that you need to double it within 24 hours?

values.label: Find something and buy cheap and sell high
It is not possible to double $100 within 24 hours.

questions.label: Which of the following best describes your sales style?

values.label: I’m charming I can convince anyone of my ideas
I never give up, I will persist through the ups and downs till it happens
I’m very strategic, I think through the details
I listen to client pain point and customize them to their needs
I go to workshops, seminars to be known in the industry.

questions.description: Answer in your local currency e.g UGX 2,000,000. Please note that all salaries will be paid in local currency.
questions.label: What is your annual salary expectation?
